author: carnivilla
title: Onboarding Untapped Communities
description: Gamers in Metaverse-like communities lack functionality and ownership with their digital property and their environment's assets.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very interesting because it does not promise to create a game itself, but a virtual environment in which players from different games can interact and learn how to use the technologies that the blockchain promotes in a more efficient and practical way, such as NFT, for example, which according to the authors of the proposal will be seen as something basic for the player to manage. I believe it is a very relevant idea because despite the blockchain universe already being a reality, this technology is much better known in some points than in others, and it is difficult for one person to learn alone what blockchain, cryptocurrencies, NFT, etc. . Even if the person is from the gaming world, depending on the context in which he is inserted, that is, if it is a country/city in which little is said and known about the world of cryptography, most likely this person will have some difficulty in enter it. If all goes well, that is, if our blockchain becomes more and more popular and the use of NFT in games becomes a widespread practice, people who do not have proper guidance on how to handle them will certainly be harmed. I believe that this idea is well related to Cardano's more general objective as well, to build a more egalitarian world, even if only in this specific part of the games. I liked it, I think if it's successfully funded and executed, it can bring new members to the Cardano ecosystem, who will likely bring other people to the blockchain as well, and so on, a network can start to be created bit by bit, and way to one day attract a lot of people to Cardano. I believe it is a very interesting proposal and one that has high chances of bringing very positive results.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is concerned with providing a short description of each member, in which we know their names and their roles, as well as (in some cases) how long the person has experience in a given area of ​​expertise. Despite that, it would be even more interesting if they provided a social networking page for each one, linkedin is always, in my opinion, the best option, because we can see there past experiences and connections of each member, so you can get to know them. them more intimately. However, here we have some serious flaws. Something that worries me is that, despite appearing capable of the project, none of the team claims to have direct involvement with our blockchain. This would be important to ensure that Cardano would benefit directly, there are other places where players can mint their digital natives, there are several possibilities to interact with blockchain; it is necessary for us to be sure how ours will be used here, because otherwise, it is not interesting to finance the learning of users who do not know for sure whether they will use Cardano's technologies. By the way, it is not clear if they would be able to teach what they propose, which team member has solid knowledge about blockchain, NFT, etc? This is not explicit in the description that is shown to us, unfortunately we need to know if they are prepared for the project itself, beyond their experiences outside the cryptographic universe. On the financial split, the team provides us with information on how the total amount would be split, giving us explanations for each topic. This gives us a good understanding of how this part of the project would develop. The script is satisfactory in terms of detail, it would be 6 months, divided into two big blocks, which we know what activities would happen in each part, so that we have a more solid vision of what is to come. However, due to the issues surrounding the qualification of the team to deal with issues in the Cardano ecosystem, I would say that this topic needs to be reformulated, so that it conveys more confidence and security in the team.
f6_assessments.q2: The team gives us direct data regarding auditability, there are expected success definitions according to the passage of time. There are two topics, specifying how the project would be successful. In this way, we can directly monitor the possible results. It would also be possible to follow the development of the project itself, through the activities that were described in the phases. I think the audibility could be done like this: we chose one or two community members to follow this project, get in touch with the team and collect the data. Monitoring, which can be brought to the community through reports. It would be extremely important that the team itself also gave us satisfaction with the process, not just the results, so that we can understand how the final product is being built beyond what is obtained at the end of the process. Therefore, I believe so, the team provides important information to monitor the project, but I would like to establish direct and constant contact between the team and the rest of the Cardano community, in order to transmit more security in general.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is aimed at an untapped community that would be able to interact with the cardano blockchain seamlessly to bring wide adoption. It would target gamers who are active in marketplaces and provide them with value and a reason to adopt cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has exprience in events, digital creation, and gaming, but it is not clear who will be doing the blockchain/NFT development and what their experience is with such. They have the two partner companies with relevant product experience, but their blockchain development is not clear. This proposal would benefit from providing more details on if that will be outsourced with the budget and who will be doing it.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal would benefit from breaking down their ideas of success down futher to judge the development vs the initial launch progress. The budget breaks down what the funds are spent on, but could be more comprehensive to improve auditability.
